meanings.definition: A quantity that is fully described by a magnitude or size only, with no direction.
meanings.sent1: The distance between the two points is a scalar measurement.
meanings.sent2: She measured the weight of the object using a scalar value.
meanings.sent3: The scalar size of the apple made it easy to fit in her pocket.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was a scalar force, strong and unwavering.
meanings.sent5: The scalar brightness of the star made it stand out in the night sky.

meanings.definition: A variable that represents a single value, rather than a set of values.
meanings.sent1: In the equation, x is a scalar representing a constant value.
meanings.sent2: The scalar in this function always returns a specific number.
meanings.sent3: The scalar amount of cookies left in the jar was disappointing.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to leave was a scalar event that changed everything.
meanings.sent5: The scalar temperature on the thermometer showed a steady 70 degrees.

meanings.definition: A physical quantity that is not affected by changes in the coordinate system.
meanings.sent1: The speed of the car is a scalar unaffected by the direction of travel.
meanings.sent2: Time is a scalar in this experiment, independent of the location.
meanings.sent3: The scalar weight of the object remained constant regardless of the angle.
meanings.sent4: His determination was a scalar force, unswayed by external factors.
meanings.sent5: The scalar volume of the container stayed the same no matter how it was turned.
